root.name: + (addition)

example.code: a = 50 + 5 # Sets 'a' to 55 b = a + 5 # Sets 'b' to 60
s1 = "Chernenko" s2 = "Brezhnev" sc1 = s1 + s2 sc2 = s1 + ", Andropov, " + s2 println(sc1) # Prints "ChernenkoBrezhnev" println(sc2) # Prints "Chernenko, Andropov, Brezhnev"
s1 = "Gorbachev" i = 1987 sc1 = s1 + str(i) println(sc1) # Prints "Gorbachev1987"

root.description: Adds two values or concatenates string values. As a mathematical operator, it calculates the sum of two values. As a string operator, it combines two strings into one. Note that for concatenation, non-string datatypes must be cast to strings using str().

parameter.label: value1
parameter.description: String, int, float, char, byte, boolean

parameter.label: value2
parameter.description: String, int, float, char, byte, boolean
